page.title: 05DRAINAGE_RIVER OUSE (ii)
page.content: The pumps can raise two hundred tons of water per minute and the height from the drain to the river is twenty feet.In the summer the water in the drainage channels is used to irrigate the crops and is fed onto the farmland from siphons and covets.One engineer and ten men look after this area .Farmers pay drainage rates of six to ten pounds an acre per year to the Drainage Board and they must buy a licence fee to irrigate their land. A Quality Officer is responisble for checking pollution and fining farmers who allow chemicals to leak into the water.A Duty Officer mans a telephone for twenty_four hours in case of emergencies.The Drainage Board is responsible for the maintenance and repair of the banks of the rivers and dams;they also cut the grass on the banks and remove weed growth.
